holidays.name: National Raspberry Cream Pie Day
holidays.description: A deliciously quirky food holiday celebrating the sweet and tangy delight of raspberry cream pie – perfect for pie lovers!
holidays.origin: Birthed from American baking enthusiasts eager to honor one of the less commonly celebrated but incredibly tasty pies.
holidays.funFact: Raspberry cream pie combines the tartness of raspberries with the smooth richness of cream, a combo that makes taste buds sing!

holidays.name: Respect for Parents Day
holidays.description: A heartfelt observance encouraging people to pause and show appreciation for their parents' love, sacrifices, and guidance.
holidays.origin: Started in the 1950s by American sociologist Dr. Henry C. Link, promoting family harmony and respect.
holidays.funFact: This day inspired the creation of Parents' Day in the United States, which is celebrated on the fourth Sunday of July.

holidays.name: Emancipation Day (Jamaica)
holidays.description: Commemorates the abolition of slavery in Jamaica in 1834, marking a critical moment in history and freedom.
holidays.origin: Honors the British Slavery Abolition Act of 1833 coming into effect on August 1, 1834, emancipating enslaved people in Jamaica.
holidays.funFact: Emancipation Day is often celebrated with music, dance, and cultural festivities honoring resilience and heritage.

holidays.name: Bubble Bath Day
holidays.description: A whimsical day dedicated to soaking in luxurious bubbles and unwinding stress with a bubbly bath!
holidays.origin: Origin unknown but embraced by stress relief enthusiasts and lovers of bath time fun worldwide.
holidays.funFact: Studies suggest that a warm bubble bath can help reduce stress and improve sleep quality, making this holiday extra relaxing!
